reviewText: This is a excellent collection of Arnold's Comedy pictures , The two best ones are Twins and Kindergarten Cop . Junior was funny it made me sqarm as a guy though, women may like it more. Arnold had guts to play that role.Every picture is nicely restored though Twins had some dirt and Scratches still left but not enough to take away the enjoyment of watching it. Thank You Universal For making available a Widescreen Version this picture instead of that goofy pan and scan version that's been out for years, it was nice to see it in it's true format again. i hadn't seen it like that since i went to the theaters to see it, years ago. what great film.the Disc with Twins and Kindergarten Cop is Double Sided and Junior is a Single Disc. All the Movies Have Trailers with them , Junior comes with a special too.Highly Recommended.

reviewText: These three movies are what kept me an Arnold movie fan when I started to tire of all that action. None of them are meant for kids, as they are all rated PG-13Twins is certainly the funniest and most romantic of the 'Arnold Comedies'!  Watching Arnold follow Danny DeVito around like a lost puppy (a very intelligent and courteous lost puppy), determined to be received as a family member, was quite hilarious. Seeing Chloe Webb and Kelly Preston as their kooky love interests was quite the bonus. There is some mystery and suspense in the twin story and the main plot (about stolen technology being sold to a competitor). Add in a large quantity of pathos from the reunion of long lost family members and the very cute romantic comedy subplot. The sum of it all is just magic. This one is not meant for kids, but is not as graphic as Kindergarten Cop's chase-and-fight scenes.Kindergarten Cop is one of my personal favorite movies. It has the gritty action while we are getting to know the cop, John Kimball, as a tough guy with no room for sentiment in his life. It has two extremely bad villains (a mother and son)!  Penelope Ann Miller does a fabulous job as Joyce Palmeri, the love interest. Joyce is smart, pretty and tough-without-the-butch. Watching John and Joyce fall for each other is a real treat. Pamela Reed is one of the best character actors of our time. As Phoebe O'Hara, John's partner, she adds depth, humanity and chuckles to this movie. Without her portrayal of the partner cop (who was SUPPOSED to be the Kindergarten teacher) it might have come dangerously close to unwatchable (due to the silly factor). Of course the children are very cute, very funny and great set-up artists. Note the whole "Not A Tumor!!" routine! Who else could bring John Kimball to his emotional knees in the course of only a couple of months? This movie is very entertaining. Just be sure you make the younger kids enjoy a few more birthdays before watching it.JUNIOR is a little weirder than the other two. It's unusual plot about two scientists (Arnold as Alexander Hess and Danny DeVito as Larry Arbogast) who want to help women conceive and carry pregnancies to term, but are denied funding to continue their work, may be hard for some to watch. It's tough because they try to prove their point by implanting an embryo into Alex!  The original intent is to allow the fetus to grow for a month or two and then stop the treatments, which would naturally terminate the pregnancy. The fetus was assumed to be absorbed into his body. Unfortunately, in his hormone-induced emotional state, Alex could not let this happen to his baby!!! This is all complicated by the relationship Alex is developing with a scientist (Emma Thompson as Diana Retton) who is working on new cryogenic technologies. (Freezing live tissue.) Without Alex's knowledge, Larry stole one of Diana's eggs (her own) from her project. So Alex is busy falling in love with Diana while he's carrying her child. This one has some embarrasing moments for the characters and the subject matter is not really for kids. Again, Pamela Reed adds to the depth and humor of an already entertaining story. It tugs at the heart strings and tickles the funny bone!Please note that the movies are all the old TV aspect ratio, not in widescreen. While I usually prefer widescreen movies, these three are still enjoyable without the widescreen addition.If you like Arnold in his funny mode, you will love all three of these movies!  Plus, the price is right!

reviewText: No, the title doesn't refer to a bird singing.This DVD collection features Arnold Schwarzenegger in three comedies:- Twins- Kindergarten Cop-  JuniorPreviously I had seen Twins and Kindergarten Cop.  Junior was a new one.  No guns!Arnold Schwarzenegger, as everyone on this planet knows, is one of the kings of the action thriller: Predator, Terminator, Last Action Hero, and so on.  There are usually lots of guns, bug guns, and explosions.  "Body count" is the theme here.So his comedic side is a different side.  In Kindergarten Cop, he sets his police persona aside to go undercover as a... kindergarten teacher.  He's stiff in this role, but that's kind of the point of the plot.  In Twins, he becomes acquainted with his lost twin, played by Danny DeVito.  He's the angel to DeVito's devil.  It has its funny and dramatic parts.  But I really liked Junior, and both DeVito and Schwarzenegger made this work by keeping in character throughout.  They didn't ever try to be funny, and thus became funny.Anyway, the point of this review is to mention that you get three DVDs for this low price.  How can you lose?  Expect the basics, get the basics, and enjoy the show.

reviewText: Great things:+ Interesting and entertaining+ Good restoration (not great but good)+ Whole family can enjoy these funny movies+ Danny DeVito and Arnold Schwarzeneger are a great team+ Three movie nights at one low price!Other notes:+ DVD cases were a little bit damaged, so the shipping could be handled better+ Picture looks a little squished on the screen, but not too noticable+ This is a basic set, so no extrasDeVito and Schwarzeneger make a great team with their sketches and situations filled with humor and sarcasm.

reviewText: Even though I rather prefer single film DVD editions, I could go with this one since the studios have finally released these great titles in widescreen and the package with an extra box is just great. The order arrived in record time and in mint condition. All films are now widesreen 1,85:1 and a great fun to watch. There are no extras or documentaries and that's why I give it 4 stars.
